reviews.text: A pretty good hotel in an excellent location, right in the heart of Valencia's main town hall square. The hotel has a starge mix of modern and old decoration and furniture that I couldn´t quite understand. My room was a good size, comfortable, well equipped, with very good air-conditioning. I asked in advance for a room on a high-floor looking out on to the square, but was assigned a low floor on the side. These small details often make a difference. So a pretty good hotel, but no more than that.
reviews.title: Pretty good, but no more than that

reviews.text: We stayed at Melia Plaza on our recent trip to Valencia, Spain as part of our honeymoon travels. The hotel is beautiful on the outside, situated in a lovely plaza that was gorgeous to look at from the balcony of our hotel room. We stayed on level 7 which was a non-smoking floor. Unfortunately the balcony did not have chairs for relaxing and enjoying the scenery. I though the room was ok, but didn't come across as "clean" feeling or "modern" as I read in other reviews. I thought the reception area of the hotel was nicer & more modern than the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of Melia Plaza is very convenient to the Valencia Nord train station (5 mins walk) and is also a great spot from which to see the very compact old town and the ritzier shopping areas. The Plaza Ayuntamento (where the hotel is located) is very attractive with a gorgeous fountain, palm trees and flower beds.
reviews.title: What you would expect from a 4 star hotel

reviews.text: Our room was a standard room - well laid out and reasonably sized as European hotels go, but there was no easy chair in the room. The sleep quality was very good - we had asked for a very quiet room so unfortunately didn't have a view - the bed was top quality, the soundproofing excellent.
reviews.title: Perfect for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Melia for 1 night before heading off to our holiday on the Costa Blanca, and I have to say we were very pleased. We were looking for a centrally-located hotel that would have its own parking, and Melia was the perfect choice. It is a beautiful building right on the Plaza del Ayuntamiento - most central! The room was nice and clean, as was the bathroom, aircon intact, which was pretty much all we needed. The parking cost us around 20 EUR and you can have the hotel staff park your car for you if you don't wish to do it yourself (you have to go around the block and then manage to find a space once inside). There's a bar in the lobby that serves tapas (although pricey) and all sorts of drinks. There's also a restarurant which looked nice but we didn't dine there. You can have tapas on any street and they're usually from 4 to 7 EUR and delicious. Can't rate the pool as we didn't have time to go up to the roof for a swim.
reviews.title: Pleasant Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed recently in the Melia Plaza, which is located in the Plaza del Ayuntamiento. This is in the center of the old city and you can walk to most of the sights that are located in the old city. So the location is superb.
reviews.title: A Very Good Hotel in the Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a superior room located on the fourth floor. The key card in this hotel is new and I have not seen it in other hotels. There is a sensor in the elevator and you have to press your card to the sensor before you choose the floor you want to go to. Anyone who does not have this key card cannot use the elevator, so this is very good for security because it prevents people who walk into the hotel from seeing anything but the lobby. The key card opens the room door by pressing it to the sensor on the door.
reviews.title: Superb Location & View from rooftop terrace

reviews.text: Our room was very large. The bed was king size and it had a very large and beautiful walnut headboard. The other furniture in the room was also made of walnut. There were three chairs, a small circular wooden table and a desk. The room had a pale yellow wallpaper and the wooden floor had a light color. The minibar was quite big and there was a big Sony TV set. There were four elegant brass lamps.
reviews.title: Excellent for City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very big and there was a large closet with mirrored doors. There were plenty of hangers in the closet. There was a door between the closet and the bedroom, to avoid noise from the corridor. The room had sound insulation and we could not hear anything from the street. We had a beautiful view of the street and the plaza.
reviews.title: Location and everything is good!

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was in a large dining room with plenty of light. What I enjoyed were the fried eggs, jamon iberico, fruits, apple pastry, and cava. The employees at the desk were very friendly and professional and gave us plenty of information about what to see in the city. Thank you to Javier and Pablo at the desk. The waiters in the breakfast room were also friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very good location, clean and nice place

reviews.text: I stayed in Melia plaza for 3 nights in February 2011. The hotel is in very good location, just in the center of the city and near to the metro station Xativa (about 7 min.walk)-very convenient. Also near to the hotel there are Mercat (where from you can buy a food), the Cathedral and other great buildings.Also the hotel is near to Colon (the commercial street).
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: I did not include the breakfast when I booked the hotel, because I think that 15 Euro is too much for breakfast, and near to the hotels there are many bakeries. My room was without day light (the windows of the room were in something as internal yard) and that is why the room was too dark. The number of the room 201. But as I was all day outside the hotel due to business work it was not a problem for me.
reviews.title: Excellant Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the future if I will visit Valencia again I will stay in the hotel, but in other room with day light and plaza view.
reviews.title: Great stay in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Melia Plaza during the Valencia National Festival in October and could not had stayed anywhere better to see all the attractions. On arrival at the airport we caught the metro to the Xativa station and walked up past the city hall and found the hotel next to the city hall a great location. It is easy to find your way around the reception staff gave us a map which was easy to follow. We asked for rooms on the top floors but when we found these were smoking floors they quickly changed our rooms for us. The rooms are spotlessly clean with all the aminities you expect from a 4* hotel. All in all an excellent place to stay for a cultural, shopping or beach holiday. The beach is a long walk but buses take you there from outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent City Location

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in a superior room for two nights. The room was very pretty, spacious, nice bathroom, curved balcony with amazing view. Service at front desk was slightly lacking, but nothing different from a few other very nice hotels we've stayed in along the way. Maybe just Spanish hospitality. Housekeeping service was great; very clean rooms and extra pillows and towels brought within minutes of request. Underground parking a half a block way...not cheap tho at 19 euros a day. Location of hotel was excellent. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Great location, great stay!

reviews.text: We were only here one night. Took the AVE from Atocha in Madrid to Valencia. You need to take a taxi to the hotel, which is well-situated on the main square - the Plaza de Ayuntamiento. Room was good size, with a little patio view of the plaza. Beds were confortable, and the bathroom had all the amenities. Location was great, with the old city, including the cathedral, behind it, and the modern city and bullring in front of it. Front desk people were friendly and offered good advice about tours and eating options. Didn't have breakfast, but there are dozens of good place within blocks.
reviews.title: Good Service, Nice Hotel, Good Location
